content: I've have always enjoyed the dragon warrior and the dragon quest series dragon quest VI is no different ty for bringing them for cell phones now how about dragon warrior VII lol.

Simply amazing. It has become my favorite game in the Zenithia Trilogy, as well as one of my favorite 1990s JRPGs. It may not be the most "narrative" of the DQ games, but all of the little stories and the lore are more than great. The graphics, music & gameplay are all superb, and it is ultimately an epic, satisfying and highly adventurous experience!

December 23 2020 the cloud saves stopped working! ive had trouble, before, with hiccups between Dragon Quest games, Google Play Games (it's not logging into ANY Dragon Quest Games, right now), and Google Drive, but usually I am able to fiddle with it and get it working, but right now I cant remember how, and clearing cache, restarting, of the apps and devices, isnt working!!! Dont let a PERFECT game be marred, by this, PLEASE collaborate with Google to restore functionality of the cloud saves!!
Does NOT work full screen on tablets.....why do they lie ? Is this app owned by DJT .
A little scatterbrained plot but lots of fun stuff. Graphics lovely to look at while playing. Great music.
Starts out slow and he's playing it all the way but hope it gets better like the fifth one
You would think that with all the promissions that cloud needs it would be able to transfer my saves from an old device to new one but you would be wrong
Its not the best dq game but i still like it
Love the dq series. Hoping to get some dq monsters...

Great grind and leveling system. The controls are good, and I personally found them better than Chronotrigger. Though not as polished (plot and graphic wise) as later editions, it is definitely worth the play of you love old school JRPGs.
Love it
YEAH!!!!! BUT, "WHERE'S: DRAGON QUEST XI"? COME ON NOW!!!!!!!!!!!;

Horrible imprecise controls, no controller support, unfriendly UI, unhelpful world map, meh graphics and terrible pixelated font face. That's what you get for 17â‚¬. Nothing new though, that's usually the case with every Square Enix mobile port. Do yourself a favor and save your money for something else. Uninstalled after 2 hours struggling with that thing.
Pretty good port still playing the game so far I'm not even finished it that's why I get to five star
Worth every penny. Just wish this had trophy achievements. The cloud save is one if the features i love about this port. I wont have to worry about starting over when getting a new phone.
I love dragon quest, but I don't love square taking the credit....shame on you square! SOFT
Good game.

A full, 40+ hour RPG for $15 is well worth it. It might be on the lower end of the Dragon Quest line up, but that still puts it way ahead of most RPGs. The phone interface may be a bit awkward at first, but after hiding the directional pad in the settings I eventually stopped noticing it. Only docking one start because this version of Dragon Quest has possibly the worst casino in the series - in other games you can bet large amounts of money and keep reloading until you get a big payout, so it only takes a little while to get the high-end prizes. In this one the betting cap is so low it's excruciating. Still, minor quibble for a huge game!
Great game. The slime minigame literally takes 3 stars away. It's that bad.
Cloud saves function doesn't work. It just sets on a black screen with a spinning circle in the top left corner

A good game of the series but the secret boss is different having to be lol 65 or greater to beat him and if you want the true/real ending you'll have to beat him in 20 turns and fight another boss after him
Great game
Awsome!!!

A very fun RPG, with a robust job system if you're into that.

my favorite among the triology

One of the best JRPGs from the 16 bit era. Awesome graphical update. Music is fantastic, of course. Probably one of the hardest DQ games, but it's a real adventure from start to finish

Digging this game so far. It's not a hand-holding experience which is nice, and there are occasional difficulty spikes which keep you on your toes.

Very disappointed that there is no option to change the display language in the app. It is automatically changed by system language setting but it's a pain to change it via system setting every time I play. To play DQ in English is my worst DQ experience ever.

This is the one that got me into Dragon Quest.  IV-VI are all great ports of DS (unlike the FF ones which aren't always very good) and run on the same engine so you really can't go wrong with any of them.

Bugged and support is useless. It played OK until I got control of the ship. I couldn't get off so I contacted support and they said they weren't a walkthrough service. It was a bug and they're just too lazy to admit it

The game itself is very good. Classic jRPG gameplay, a deep class system and great-for-the-time graphics and sound. But I have to take off two stars for the glitch that kept cloud save from working for two and a half months. It's fine now, but who knows when another bug will come along? And if you look at FF7, you'll see that sometimes Squeenix Android bugs just never get fixed. Buy at your own risk!
Doesn't quite match up to IV and V. It requires too much grinding, and is confusing at times.
Great port of a classic rpg
Fun
I prever dragon quest above final fantasy due to better gameplay.

This game along with all the other Dragon Quests are for you. I've played and beat them all including the soon offs. VI is set apart from the rest by the class leveling system, the story is absolutely crazy.(imo the best intro to a DQ game).

Pros: delivers what it says.  Old-timey rpg, with the familiar tropes and functions.   Have tried several Dragon Quest games, and this one has added some new features and is trying to play big ball.                                          Cons: I have gone through several DQ games now, hoping to recapture the glory days of SNES rpgs, and so far, they have failed miserably.  The game play is there, but the characters have zero personality, the music is blah, and there's really no decent storytelling at all.
Love it

This series is the best. I can't wait for Dragon Quest Heroes on PS4 and this shows why we need more Dragon Quest games on consoles and over in the West period.
My Asus memo pad 7 ran all the other dragon quest games fine. But this game does not even show up on the play store on my tablet. Let's fix this.
One of my favorite games. So many memories. But I have been picking up items and then they will not be in my inventory. The only way to make this better would be to add a screen rotation feature.

Yet further proof why this series is the finest. Square Enix should be ashamed for not having advertised properly in the West. The folks should tell them that with a little effort, other titles such as DQ 10 and the 3DS games would easily sell here.   Factually, the original DS version of this remake of DQ6 sold well in the West, despite the uneducated minority claiming otherwise. Again, SE should be ashamed for not continuing to push this series after DQ6 DS's success.
My favorite of all the series

Like all Dragon Quest games, it very well balanced, fun and well designed. I like DQ6 just a bit less than 4&5, mostly because this one have times where the user is forced to speak to everyone in an area, which can really feel like a drag. Android is very good as usual.
Good game
Amazing art and gameplay blended with wonderful yet polished story.
The story is interesting,the graphics are nice & vibrant,controls are really good & the gameplay rocks.A really solid mobile rpg.Even better than FF titles on android.
Dragon Quest games have in my opinion stood the test of time. An excellent JRPG worthy of your spare time.

Big fan of the Super Famicom game, I was stoked to get this.  Portrait - only mode doesn't bother me in the least: sprites are big and colorful, and it's perfect for when I have a sleeping baby on my shoulder.  Fluid enemy animations, rotatable villages, official script (as good as DQ VIII's translation), plus a few new mini games and a couple other features make this a must - have for fans of the series.  (Note: You can only quick save on the world map, so you're s.o.l. in a dungeon.)
Now to patiently wait for dqvii...
Fantastic. Like all DQs. Now, how about that DQ7 english release?
The portrait mode only stinks.

Glad this is here, the story is great and I really like the refined job system (which was even more refined in VII, easily the best of the series - keeping my fingers crossed it comes to Android). Definitely worth it.
